title: Roasted New Red Potatoes Recipe
description: Roasted red potatoes tossed with olive oil, salt, and pepper, then cooked in the oven until tender in the middle and perfectly crisp on the outside.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Side Dish Potato Roasted Potato Recipes Roasted New Red Potatoes 4.7 (1,430) 939 Reviews 158 Photos Roasted red potatoes at their best — plain and simple. Red potatoes are tossed with olive oil, salt, and pepper, then roasted to perfection. Submitted by USA WEEKEND columnist Pam Anderson Updated on February 13, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 158 158 158 158 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 20 mins Total Time: 25 mins Servings: 8 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 3 pounds small red new potatoes, halved ¼ cup olive oil 1 teaspoon salt and freshly ground black pepper Directions Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) and adjust the oven rack to the lowest position. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Toss potatoes with oil, salt, and pepper in a bowl. Arrange, cut-side down, on a rimmed cookie sheet or jellyroll pan. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Roast potatoes in the preheated oven until tender and golden brown, 20 to 30 minutes. Transfer to a serving dish. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Serve and enjoy! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 2,728 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 179 Calories 7g Fat 27g Carbs 3g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 8 Calories 179 % Daily Value * Total Fat 7g 9% Saturated Fat 1g 5% Sodium 301mg 13% Total Carbohydrate 27g 10% Dietary Fiber 3g 10% Total Sugars 2g Protein 3g 6% Vitamin C 15mg 16% Calcium 17mg 1% Iron 1mg 7% Potassium 775mg 16% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Roasted New Red Potatoes 01 of 158 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 158 Photo by  Gracie Ringering 08/09/2023 The directions were easy and I was able to make this all by myself. 03 of 158 Photo by  SappySpam9646 12/30/2022 This recipe is easy and So Good. I add a little garlic salt to mine. Also I cut them into smaller pieces. I have to flip them several time but 25-30 minutes is about right. I'm cooking them now as I'm typing 04 of 158 Photo by  AdamsFam 08/18/2021 05 of 158 Photo by  AdamsFam 08/18/2021 06 of 158 Photo by  Shan 08/02/2021 07 of 158 Photo by  Shan 08/02/2021 08 of 158 Photo by  Taris 07/18/2021 So easy to make & super yummy! They turned out perfectly baked! The only difference is I added freshly chopped thyme. I will definitely make this again. 09 of 158 Photo by  i_am_jayray 05/15/2021 The roasted new potatoes came out perfect. Thanks. The recipe was super easy. 10 of 158 Photo by  jason cordle 04/16/2021 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love How to Make Roasted Red Potatoes 121 Ratings Easy Roasted Potatoes 42 Ratings Honey-Mustard Roasted Potatoes 42 Ratings Roasted Wild Mushrooms and Potatoes 36 Ratings Healthier Oven-Roasted Potatoes 218 Ratings Roasted Potatoes with Greens 433 Ratings Honey-Roasted Potatoes and Mushrooms 6 Ratings Pantry Potatoes 10 Ratings Honey-Roasted Red Potatoes 8 Ratings Dijon Roasted Potatoes 39 Ratings Roasted Potatoes with Tomatoes, Basil, and Garlic 128 Ratings Roasted Rosemary Onion Potatoes 62 Ratings Roast Potatoes 714 Ratings Skillet-Roasted Fingerling Potatoes 3 Ratings Oven Roasted Red Potatoes and Asparagus 394 Ratings Mustard-Dill Roasted Fingerling Potatoes 7 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: USA WEEKEND columnist Pam Anderson
instructions: Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) and adjust the oven rack to the lowest position. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Toss potatoes with oil, salt, and pepper in a bowl. Arrange, cut-side down, on a rimmed cookie sheet or jellyroll pan. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Roast potatoes in the preheated oven until tender and golden brown, 20 to 30 minutes. Transfer to a serving dish. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Serve and enjoy!
